oop_pony_gp module¶

class oop_pony_gp.GP(population_size, max_size, generations, elite_size, crossover_probability, mutation_probability, fitness_function, symbols)¶

Bases: object

Genetic Programming implementation.

Attributes:

  • Population size – Size of the population
  • Solution size – Max size of the nodes which represents an individual solution
  • Max depth – Max depth of a tree, this is a function of the solution size
  • Generations – Number of iterations of the search loop
  • Elite size – Number of individuals preserved between generations
  • Crossover probability – Probability of crossing over two solutions
  • Mutation probability – Probability of mutating a solution
  • Fitness function – Method used to evaluate fitness
  • Symbols – The symbols that a GP tree can be built from
POPULATION_FILE
File where population is saved
POPULATION_FILE = 'gp_population.dat'¶
classmethod evaluate_fitness(individuals, fitness_function)¶

Perform the fitness evaluation for each individual.

Parameters:
  • individuals (list) – Population to evaluate
  • fitness_function (Object) – Fitness function to evaluate the population on
generational_replacement(new_population, old_population)¶

Return new a population. The elite_size best old_population are appended to the new population. They are kept in the new population if they are better than the worst.

Parameters:
  • new_population (list) – the new population
  • old_population (list) – the old population
Returns:

the new population with the best from the old population
Return type:

list
classmethod get_max_depth(size)¶

Return the max depth of a binary tree given a size. The size is the number of nodes.

Parameters:size (int) – Number of tree nodes
Returns:Max depth of the binary tree
Return type:int
initialize_population()¶

Ramped half-half initialization. The individuals in the population are initialized using the grow or the full method for each depth value (ramped) up to max_depth.

Returns:List of individuals
Return type:list
print_stats(generation, individuals)¶

Print the statistics for the generation and population.

:param generation:generation number :type generation: int :param individuals: population to get statistics for :type individuals: list

run()¶

Return the best solution. Create an initial population. Perform an evolutionary search.

Returns:Best solution
Return type:Individual
search_loop(population)¶

Return the best individual from the evolutionary search loop. Starting from the initial population.

Parameters:population (list) – Initial population of individuals
Returns:Best individual
Return type:Individual
subtree_crossover(parent1, parent2)¶

Returns two individuals. The individuals are created by selecting two random nodes from the parents and swapping the subtrees.

Parameters:
  • parent1 (Individual) – Individual to crossover
  • parent2 (Individual) – Individual to crossover
Returns:

Two new individuals
Return type:

tuple
subtree_mutation(individual)¶

Return a new individual by randomly picking a node and growing a new subtree from it.

Parameters:individual (Individual) – Individual to mutate
Returns:Mutated individual
Return type:Individual
tournament_selection(population, tournament_size=2)¶

Return individuals from a population by drawing tournament_size competitors randomly and selecting the best of the competitors. population_size number of tournaments are held.

Parameters:
  • population (list) – Population to select from
  • tournament_size (int) – Size of a tournament
Returns:

selected individuals
Return type:

list
class oop_pony_gp.Individual(genome)¶

Bases: object

A GP Individual.

Attributes:
  • Genome – A tree
  • Fitness – The fitness value of the individual
DEFAULT_FITNESS
Default fitness value of an unevaluated individual
DEFAULT_FITNESS = -1000¶
class oop_pony_gp.SymbolicRegression(fitness_cases, targets)¶

Bases: object

Evaluate fitness based on fitness cases and target values. Fitness cases are a set of exemplars (input and output points) by comparing the error between the output of an individual(symbolic expression) and the target values.

Attributes:

  • Fitness cases – Input values for the exemplars
  • Targets – The target values corresponding to the fitness case
  • Variables – The current value of the variables in the evaluated exemplar
evaluate(node)¶

Evaluate a node recursively. The node’s symbol is evaluated.

Parameters:node (TreeNode) – Evaluated node
Returns:Value of the evaluation
Return type:float
class oop_pony_gp.Symbols(arities)¶

Bases: object

Symbols are functions (internal nodes) or terminals (leaves)

Attributes:
  • Arities – Dictionary with the symbol as a key and the arity of symbol

the symbol as the value - Terminals – List of the terminal symbols, arity is 0 - Functions – List of the function symbols, arity greater than 0

get_rnd_symbol(depth, max_depth, full=False)¶

Get a random symbol. The depth determines if a terminal must be chosen. If full is specified a function will be chosen until the max depth.

Parameters:
  • depth (int) – current depth
  • max_depth (int) – maximum allowed depth
  • full (bool) – grow to full depth
Returns:

symbol
Return type:

str
class oop_pony_gp.Tree(root)¶

Bases: object

A Tree has a root which is an object of class TreeNode

Attributes:

  • Root – The root node of the tree
  • Node count – The number of nodes in the tree
  • Depth – The maximum depth of the tree
calculate_depth()¶

Return the maximum depth of the tree.

Returns:Maximum depth of the tree
Return type:int
depth_first(root)¶

Return a list of nodes of recursively collected by pre-order depth-first left-to-right traversal.

Parameters:root (TreeNode) – Start of traversal
Returns:list of nodes in pre-order
Return type:list
static get_depth(node)¶

Return depth of node by counting the number of parents when traversing up the tree.

Parameters:node (TreeNode) – Node which depth is calculated
Returns:depth of node in tree
Return type:int
grow(node, depth, max_depth, full, _symbols)¶

Recursively grow a node to max depth in a pre-order, i.e. depth-first left-to-right traversal.

Parameters:
  • node (TreeNode) – Root node of subtree
  • depth (int) – Current tree depth
  • max_depth (int) – Maximum tree depth
  • full (bool) – grows the tree to max depth when true
  • _symbols (Symbols) – set of symbols to chose from
class oop_pony_gp.TreeNode(parent=None, symbol=None)¶

Bases: object

A node in a tree.

Attributes:
  • Parent – The parent of the node. None indicates no parent, i.e. root

node - Symbol – The label of the node - Children – The children of the node

str_as_tree()¶

Return an s-expression for the node and its descendants.

Returns:S-expression
Return type:str
oop_pony_gp.get_arities()¶

Return a symbol object. Helper method to keep the code clean.

Returns:Symbols used for GP individuals
Return type:Symbols
oop_pony_gp.get_test_and_train_data(fitness_cases_file, test_train_split)¶

Return test and train data.

Parameters:
  • fitness_cases_file (str) – CSV file with a header.
  • test_train_split (float) – Percentage of exemplar data used for training
Returns:

Test and train data. Both cases and targets
Return type:

tuple
oop_pony_gp.main()¶

Search. Evaluate best solution on out-of-sample data

oop_pony_gp.out_of_sample_test(individual, fitness_cases, targets)¶

Out-of-sample test on an individual solution

Parameters:
  • individual (Individual) – Solution to test on data
  • fitness_cases (list) – Input data used for testing
  • targets (list) – Target values of data
oop_pony_gp.parse_exemplars(file_name)¶

Parse a CSV file. Parse the fitness case and split the data into Test and train data. In the fitness case file each row is an exemplar and each dimension is in a column. The last column is the target value of the exemplar.

Parameters:file_name (str) – CSV file with header
Returns:Fitness cases and targets
Return type:list
